invoke.input_question: Using each company's 2024 sustainability/ESG report, what is the combined total of Scope 3 Category 11 ("Use of sold products") greenhouse gas emissions reported by Shell plc and BP p.l.c.? Answer with a single number in million metric tons CO2e, rounded to one decimal.

info.tool_calls:
[ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': 'Shell 2024 Sustainability report Scope 3 category 11 "Use of sold products"', 'max_results': 5}, result=[{'title': 'Scope 3 Emissions and the Energy Transition: A Glimpse into the ...', 'url': 'https://www.eba-net.org/scope-3-emissions-and-the-energy-transition/', 'content': '- In the Shell 2024 Sustainability report, Scope 3 emissions, particularly Category 11 "Use of sold products," are highlighted as a significant aspect of the company's overall emissions profile. For 2023, Shell reported an estimated 319 million metric tons of CO₂-equivalent emissions from its own production and an additional 559 million metric tons from third-party products in this category. This indicates a substantial impact from the combustion of sold energy products, which is a critical area of focus for Shell's sustainability efforts. 

Shell's reporting includes emissions across all fifteen categories outlined by the Greenhouse Gas Protocol (GHGP), emphasizing the importance of transparency and third-party assurance in its emissions data. The company also provides detailed methodologies for calculating emissions, showcasing its commitment to accountability in its sustainability practices. 

Overall, Shell's approach to Scope 3 emissions reflects the broader challenges and opportunities within the oil and gas sector regarding emissions accountability and the transition to a low-carbon economy.', 'engine': 'ggl_search', 'engines': ['ggl_search']}], tool_call_id='call_iRoVC4AW3pQB7DRSh6oCt5du', images=None), ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': 'Shell Sustainability Report 2024 Scope 3 Category 11 Use of sold products 2023 million tonnes', 'max_results': 10}, result=[{'title': 'Shell publishes Energy Transition Strategy 2024 | Financial Post', 'url': 'https://financialpost.com/globe-newswire/shell-publishes-energy-transition-strategy-2024', 'content': '- In the Shell Sustainability Report 2024, customer emissions from the use of sold oil products (Scope 3, Category 11) were reported as 517 million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent (CO2e) in 2023. This represents a decrease from 569 million tonnes CO2e in 2021 and a significant reduction from 819 million tonnes CO2e in 2016. Shell has set a new ambition to reduce these customer emissions by 15-20% by 2030 compared to 2021 levels, which translates to a reduction of more than 40% compared to 2016 reported emissions.', 'engine': 'tavily_search', 'engines': ['tavily_search']}], tool_call_id='call_eLL8d7Qp0Dj7TISAVGqihKz4', images=None), ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': "Shell Sustainability Report 2024 Scope 3 Category 11 'Use of sold products' 2023 2024 report PDF", 'max_results': 10}, result=[{'title': 'Scope 3 Emissions and the Energy Transition: A Glimpse into the ...', 'url': 'https://www.eba-net.org/scope-3-emissions-and-the-energy-transition/', 'content': "- The document discusses Scope 3 emissions, particularly focusing on the oil and gas industry, and highlights the regulatory challenges and corporate disclosure practices related to these emissions. Scope 3 emissions, which include indirect emissions from a company's value chain, are significant for oil and gas companies, often comprising 80% to 95% of their total carbon footprint. The document evaluates the regulatory frameworks affecting Scope 3 disclosures, including the SEC Climate Disclosure Rules, California’s SB 253, and the EU’s Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

Key points regarding Shell's Scope 3 emissions for 2023 include:
- Shell disclosed Scope 3 emissions across all fifteen categories outlined by the Greenhouse Gas Protocol (GHGP), with a focus on downstream emissions from the use of sold products.
- For 2023, Shell reported an estimated 319 million metric tons of CO₂-equivalent emissions from its own production and 559 million metric tons from third-party products in the 'use of sold products' category (Category 11).
- Shell also reported upstream emissions from purchased goods and services (70 million metric tons CO₂e), capital goods (20 million metric tons CO₂e), and upstream transportation and distribution (10 million metric tons CO₂e).
- The company subjects its Scope 3 data to third-party assurance processes and publishes detailed methodologies for calculating emissions.

The document emphasizes the importance of harmonized standards and technological innovation to improve emissions accountability and advance the global energy transition. It also highlights the challenges faced by companies in navigating diverse regulatory requirements and the need for greater transparency and accountability in emissions reporting.", 'engine': 'ggl_search', 'engines': ['ggl_search']}], tool_call_id='call_3MKKww7RtkPZGZKaIWijgrZ8', images=None), ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': 'Shell Sustainability Report 2024 pdf Scope 3 Category 11 use of sold products 2023', 'max_results': 10}, result=[{'title': 'Scope 3 Emissions and the Energy Transition: A Glimpse into the ...', 'url': 'https://www.eba-net.org/scope-3-emissions-and-the-energy-transition/', 'content': "- The document discusses Scope 3 emissions, particularly focusing on the oil and gas industry, and highlights the regulatory challenges and corporate disclosure practices related to these emissions. Scope 3 emissions, which include indirect emissions from a company's value chain, are significant for oil and gas companies, often comprising 80% to 95% of their total carbon footprint. The document evaluates the regulatory frameworks affecting Scope 3 disclosures, including the SEC Climate Disclosure Rules, California's SB 253, and the EU's Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

Key points regarding Scope 3 Category 11 (use of sold products) emissions for 2023 from major oil companies include:
